title: The British Conservatives who rebelled and will be expelled from party
text:
LONDON (Reuters) - Twenty-one lawmakers in the ruling Conservative Party rebelled against Prime Minster Boris Johnson on Tuesday by backing the first step towards legislating to block a no-deal Brexit. They will be expelled from the Conservative Party.

David Gauke, Lord Chancellor and Secretary of State for Justice, is seen outside Downing Street in London, Britain July 23, 2019. REUTERS/Peter Nicholls

The 21 lawmakers are as follows:

Guto Bebb

Alistair Burt

David Gauke

Sam Gyimah

Richard Harrington

Anne Milton

Nicholas Soames

Richard Benyon

Greg Clark

Justine Greening

Philip Hammond

Margot James

Caroline Nokes

Rory Stewart

Steve Brine

Kenneth Clarke

Dominic Grieve

Stephen Hammond

FILE PHOTO: Alistair Burt arrives at 10 Downing Street as Britain's re-elected Prime Minister David Cameron names his new cabinet, in central London, Britain May 11, 2015. REUTERS/Neil Hall

Oliver Letwin

Antoinette Sandbach

Edward Vaizey
description: Twenty-one lawmakers in the ruling Conservative Party rebelled against Prime Minster Boris Johnson on Tuesday by backing the first step towards legislating to block a no-deal Brexit. They will be expelled from the Conservative Party.
